RACE.RACE_TEXT: CHARLES TOWN RACE 1 6 1/2F Dirt CR: 84. Claiming Purse 14200. FOR THREE YEAR OLDS AND UPWARD WHICH HAVE NOT WON TWO RACES SINCE MARCH 1, 2023 OR WHICH HAVE NEVER WON FOUR RACES. Three Year Olds, 122 lbs.; Older, 124 lbs. Non-winners Of Two Races Since March 1 Allowed 2 lbs. Claiming Price $6,250 (Races Where Entered For $5,000 Or Less Not Considered In Eligibility)(W V A Races Not Considered In Eligibility).
RACE.FOOTNOTES: MONTAUK DADDY rated off the pace inside, started a bid nearing the three eighths pole and improved at the rail on the far turn, eased out leaving the turn and dug in to take over late yards. HEY CONGRATS bobbled leaving the gate but took over toward the three quarter pole and moved to the inside to rate the pace, came under pressure passing the three eighths pole, rounded the far turn at the rail and dug in under steady stretch handling, but was caught in the final yards. HAPPY CHARLIE saved early ground, picked up the chase leaving the seven sixteenths pole and entered the far turn about the three path, angled to the eight path through the turn and came along widest to take third late yards. HIS ROYAL G exchanged contact with Happy Champ leaving the gate then stalked from the two and three paths, challenged toward the three eighths pole but dropped back approaching the five sixteenths, raced in the four path on the far turn and flattened in the lane. OVERBEARING saved ground, gave chase nearing the three eighths pole, rounded the far turn at the rail and showed little further. HAPPY CHAMP exchanged contact with His Royal G leaving the gate and raced two deep on the opening turn, stalked three wide into the backstretch then challenged toward the three eighths pole, but, faded approaching the far turn. RRACE DAY WARRIOR rounded the opening turn about the four path, left the turn outside and showed little response through the backstretch. This race was hand timed.

ENTRY.NAME: Montauk Daddy
ENTRY.COMMENT: off pace inside,bid 3/8,rail turn,eased out,up late yards

WINNERS_DETAILS.BREEDER: Jennifer A. Johnson & Gillian K. Johnson

ENTRY.NAME: Happy Champ
ENTRY.OWNER: Brown Nicole and Brown Ronney W

ENTRY.NAME: His Royal G
ENTRY.OWNER: Pepe Stable and J L M Jacona Stable

RACE.RACE_TEXT: CHARLES TOWN RACE 2 4 1/2F Dirt CR: 67. Maiden Special Weight Purse 26500. FOR ACCREDITED WEST VIRGINIA-BRED MAIDENS, TWO YEARS OLD. Weight, 122 lbs.
RACE.FOOTNOTES: DORADO gave chase through the backstretch, rounded the turn off the rail, dueled to the lead mid-stretch and edged clear later yards. RACING HOT LINE gave chase, raced at the rail on the turn and dug in to take second later yards. GREATEST NOTION rated the early pace, was urged clear past the three eighths pole, raced at the rail on the turn but was met mid-stretch and relented later yards. ALEXANDER GRADY gave chase toward the inside, raced at the rail on the turn and ran evenly in the lane. LOVE IS WICKED chased through the backstretch, rounded the turn about the five path and finished evenly. WYSOQUIET became fractious in the gate and never factored. BREAK THE CHAINS was hustled along with the early pace, dropped back approaching the five sixteenths pole, roughed from tight quarters at the rail, was taken up while bearing out on the turn and walked off post race.

ENTRY.NAME: Break the Chains
ENTRY.COMMENT: hustled with pace,roughed in tight 1/4,bore out turn,walked off

ENTRY.NAME: Alexander Grady
ENTRY.OWNER: O'Sullivan Farms LLC and Steinmann Eric

ENTRY.NAME: Racing Hot Line
ENTRY.COMMENT: chased,rail turn,dug in lane,up 2nd later yards

ENTRY.NAME: Greatest Notion
ENTRY.COMMENT: rated pace,urged clear 3/8,rail turn,met 1/16,relented later yrds

ENTRY.NAME: Dorado
ENTRY.COMMENT: chased,off rail turn,dueled to lead 1/16,edged clear late

RACE.RACE_TEXT: CHARLES TOWN RACE 3 1 1/16M Dirt CR: 81. Claiming Purse 14200. FOR THREE YEAR OLDS AND UPWARD WHICH HAVE NOT WON TWO RACES SINCE MARCH 1, 2023 OR WHICH HAVE NEVER WON FOUR RACES. Three Year Olds, 122 lbs.; Older, 124 lbs. Non-winners Of Two Races At A Mile Or Over Since March 1 Allowed 2 lbs. Claiming Price $5,000, i f for $4,500, allowed 2 lbs. (Races Where Entered For $4,000 Or Less Not Considered In Eligibility)(W V A Races Not Considered In Eligibility).
RACE.FOOTNOTES: TUSKEGEE CAT stalked from the three path, closed to the front approaching the five sixteenths pole and raced clear midway on the far turn, dug in under steady stretch handling and held on well. MONGOLIAN HERO settled off the rail, started a bid approaching the three eighths pole and rounded the far turn about the three path, then hung at the outside flank of the winner through the lane. JASONTAKESLONG raced with the early pace two deep, took the lead at the nine sixteenths pole and came under pressure toward the seven sixteenths, was met at the five sixteenths, dropped back at the rail midway through the far turn and flattened in the lane. ROCKY DICE settled off the pace about the three path, gave chase leaving the nine sixteenths pole but flattened off the rail on the far turn. KING THEO saved ground and showed little response through the backstretch. LADDIE LIAM settled back in the three and four paths, raced outside into the backstretch and gave chase toward the seven sixteenths pole, but flattened in the four path on the far turn. MAKE THE WAY CLEAR raced with the early pace inside, was met at the nine sixteenths pole, gave way leaving the half mile pole and was not encouraged further.

ENTRY.NAME: Mongolian Hero
ENTRY.COMMENT: off rail,bid 3/8,3p far turn,hung through lane

ENTRY.NAME: Tuskegee Cat
ENTRY.COMMENT: stalked 3p,up near 5/16,cleared mid turn,held well driving

ENTRY.NAME: Make the Way Clear
ENTRY.COMMENT: with early pace,met 9/16,gave way past 1/2,not encouraged

RACE.RACE_TEXT: CHARLES TOWN RACE 4 4 1/2F Dirt CR: 56. Maiden Special Weight Purse 26500. FOR MAIDENS, FILLIES AND MARES THREE, FOUR, FIVE, AND SIX YEARS OLD. Three Year Olds, 120 lbs.; Older, 124 lbs.
RACE.FOOTNOTES: SHE'S A LINO gave chase and took the lead two deep leaving the quarter pole, raced clear approaching the eighth pole, dug in under steady handling and edged further away the final sixteenth. CALERA LOVE was hustled with the lead while angling in and had her heels clipped in the vicinity of the seven sixteenths pole, gave up the lead past the quarter, dropped back at the rail entering the stretch and relented the final sixteenth. AZTECA GIRL gave early chase but had to check to avoid a fallen rider past the seven sixteenths pole, quickly recovered stride but it was to no avail. ZIDORMI gave chase, though was not a factor. SHESARUNAWAYTRAIN gave chase outside and never factored. LINDA'S TAJ engaged in close early chase but clipped the heels of the errant Calera Love in the vicinity of the seven sixteenths pole, lost her rider in the process and walked off post race. A Stewards inquiry resulted in the disqualification of Calera Love to fifth place for the incident in the vicinity of the seven sixteenths pole.

ENTRY.NAME: Linda's Taj
ENTRY.COMMENT: close early,clipped heels near 7/16,lost rider,walked off

ENTRY.NAME: She's a Lino
ENTRY.COMMENT: chased,up 2d past 1/4,clear near 1/8,edged away later yards

WINNERS_DETAILS.BREEDER: Heather B. Hunter & Dr. F. E. Hunter

RACE.RACE_TEXT: CHARLES TOWN RACE 5 7F Dirt CR: 83. Claiming Purse 17600. FOR THREE YEAR OLDS AND UPWARD WHICH HAVE NEVER WON TWO RACES. Three Year Olds, 122 lbs.; Older, 124 lbs. Non-winners Of Two Races Allowed 2 lbs. Claiming Price $15,000, if for $12,500, allowed 2 lbs. (Races Where Entered For $10,000 Or Less Not Considere d In Weight Allowances)(W V A Races Not Considered In Eligibility).
RACE.FOOTNOTES: THEWITCHISGONE raced with the runner-up through the front stretch then took the lead past the five eighths pole and rated the pace, dug in to the challenge of REMYS SHOWTIME leaving the three eighths pole, cleared that one off the rail midway on the far turn and dug in under steady encouragement to hold on. The latter ducked out and made contact with Sargent Kobe leaving the gate then showed the way with a slim early lead, was met past the five eighths pole and stalked from that point, challenged the winner toward the three eighths, dropped back at the rail midway on the far turn but came back gamely in late stretch. PERSONABLE settled in the four path the opening turn, picked up the chase leaving the turn and improved through the backstretch, raced close in the four path on the far turn and ran evenly in the stretch. LEG UP saved ground on the first turn, gave chase nearing the seven sixteenths pole, raced off the rail on the far turn then flattened stride later yards. RAGTIME RICHES saved ground off the pace, edged closer leaving the three eighths pole and gave chase from the five sixteenths, rounded the far turn at the rail but flattened stride in the lane. VOICE OF NOW raced off the rail on the first turn, picked up the chase from the seven sixteenths pole then faded in the four path on the far turn. SARGENT KOBE was bumped then shut off leaving the gate, rounded the first turn in the three path and showed little response through the backstretch.

ENTRY.NAME: Sargent Kobe
ENTRY.COMMENT: bumped out,shut off break,3p 1st turn,little response

ENTRY.NAME: Leg Up
ENTRY.COMMENT: saved ground,chased 7/16,off rail far turn,flattened later yards

ENTRY.NAME: Thewitchisgone
ENTRY.COMMENT: w/pace,up past 5/8,inched clear mid turn,held on driving

RACE.RACE_TEXT: CHARLES TOWN RACE 6 6 1/2F Dirt CR: 76. Maiden Special Weight Purse 26500. FOR MAIDENS, THREE, FOUR, FIVE, AND SIX YEARS OLD. Three Year Olds, 120 lbs.; Older, 124 lbs.
RACE.FOOTNOTES: YO VINNIE became edgy in the gate, took the lead at the three quarter pole and moved to the inside to set the pace, was met into the backstretch, dueled from the three eighths and recovered the nod toward the five sixteenths pole, raced clear leaving the far turn and was kept alert through the lane. DREAM FORCE tapered in and stalked two deep, took the nod into the backstretch and was forced into a duel toward the three eighths, gave up the lead approaching the five sixteenths pole, contested at a close disadvantage two deep on the far turn but dropped back into the lane and settled for second best. SOMEBODY LOVES ME saved ground on the first turn, gave chase into the backstretch and raced at the rail on the far turn, then cleared third past the eighth pole. NEVER FOR SPEIGHT saved ground on the opening turn, gave chase leaving the half mile pole, raced off the rail on the far turn then flattened stride. EL REY DE PAPA raced in the three path the first turn and showed little response through the backstretch. RUM CUP became a bit edgy in the gate, raced in the three and four paths on the first turn and was not a factor. HEYLOOKMAIMADEIT hesitated at the break then loped around.

ENTRY.NAME: Never for Speight
ENTRY.COMMENT: saved ground,chased past 1/2,off rail far turn,flattened

ENTRY.NAME: Dream Force
ENTRY.OWNER: Brown Nicole and Brown Ronney W

RACE.RACE_TEXT: CHARLES TOWN RACE 7 6 1/2F Dirt CR: 70. Allowance Purse 27400. FOR ACCREDITED WEST VIRGINIA-BRED THREE YEAR OLDS AND UPWARD WHICH HAVE NEVER WON TWO RACES. Three Year Olds, 122 lbs.; Older, 124 lbs. Non-winners Of A Race Since August 1 Allowed 2 lbs. A Race Since July 1 Allowed 4 lbs. (Races Where Entered For $12,50 0 Or Less Not Considered In Weight Allowances).
RACE.FOOTNOTES: JAZZ WITH DENIS tapered in through the front stretch, took the lead into the first turn and rated the pace, came under pressure leaving the three eighths pole, contested the advantage at the rail on the far turn and was steadily handled to hold on. CIDERHOUSE WAY rounded the first turn in the three path, picked up the chase nearing the three eighths pole, raced close in the three path on the far turn and dueled through the stretch for second. VAGABOND VIRGIN stalked the early pace from the two and three paths, gave chase nearing the three eighths pole and raced close at the rail on the far turn, but was outfinished in the stretch duel for second. O'RIGSBY raced in the four path the first turn, gave chase from the three eighths pole, rounded the far turn about the three path and finished well. XCELLENT START raced off the rail on the opening turn, gave chase nearing the three eighths pole, rounded the far turn in the four and five paths, left the turn widest and flattened the final sixteenth. I'M THE MONEY MAN rated close inside on the first turn, picked up the chase past the half mile pole but weakened at the rail on the far turn. DOCTOR PARDO saved early ground, gave chase from the seven sixteenths pole, rounded the far turn about the three path and showed little in the lane. BORN TO SIN raced with the early pace through the front stretch then stalked into the first turn, gave chase past the seven sixteenths pole but weakened at the rail on the far turn. MEETMARYSMAN saved ground. LIEUTENANT BROWN raced well off the pace in the three and four paths and never factored.

ENTRY.NAME: Xcellent Start
ENTRY.OWNER: Coleswood Farm, Inc. and Raim, David

ENTRY.NAME: I'm the Money Man
ENTRY.COMMENT: rated close inside,chased past 1/2,weakened rail far turn

ENTRY.NAME: Born to Sin
ENTRY.COMMENT: with early pace,stalked 5/8,chased 7/16,weakened rail far turn

ENTRY.NAME: Doctor Pardo
ENTRY.COMMENT: saved ground,chased 7/16,3p far turn,little in lane

ENTRY.NAME: Jazz With Denis
ENTRY.COMMENT: up 2d 5/8,rated pace,pressured 3/8,rail far turn,held on driving

RACE.RACE_TEXT: CHARLES TOWN RACE 8 7F Dirt CR: 65. Maiden Special Weight Purse 26500. FOR ACCREDITED WEST VIRGINIA-BRED MAIDENS, THREE, FOUR, FIVE, AND SIX YEARS OLD. Three Year Olds, 120 lbs.; Older, 124 lbs.
RACE.FOOTNOTES: SUMMONING DENIS settled in the three and four paths the first turn, started a bid leaving the seven sixteenths pole and took the nod at the rail approaching the quarter pole, contested even terms through the far turn, dueled clear past the eighth pole and was steadily handled to late stretch. JUST CALL ME AL stalked from the three path the first turn, bid nearing the three eighths pole, raced close three wide on the far turn and dueled through the stretch for second. ALDARIGHTTRICKS stalked the early pace two deep, took a brief slim lead nearing the three eighths pole but was met approaching the quarter pole, contested even terms two deep through the far turn, dropped back inside the eighth pole and was outfinished in the stretch duel for second. MY BUDDY DUANE settled in the four path the first turn, left the turn outside and gave chase toward the seven sixteenths pole, raced at the rail on the far turn, drifted through the upper stretch and flattened stride. BAD LINEAGE came away a bit awkwardly then saved ground on the first turn, eased out leaving the turn and gave chase toward the seven sixteenths pole, rounded the far turn about the three path and showed little further. CALYPSO JOHN rated close off the rail on the first turn, gave chase nearing the seven sixteenths pole then flattened at the rail on the far turn. DISCREET LOVE was bumped at the break, saved ground on the opening turn and showed little response through the backstretch. JOOBY DOOBY DOO came away awkwardly and was pinched back at the break, saved ground on the first turn, gave chase past the seven sixteenths pole but weakened at the rail on the far turn. REAL RICK was never a factor. DOG TOWN ALLEN ducked out leaving the gate and made contact with Discreet Love, took a slim lead through the front stretch and showed the way, but was met approaching the three eighths pole and gave way readily.

ENTRY.NAME: Dog Town Allen
ENTRY.COMMENT: ducked out,bumped break,slim lead,met 3/8,gave way readily

ENTRY.NAME: Calypso John
ENTRY.COMMENT: rated close off rail,chased 7/16,flattened rail far turn

ENTRY.NAME: Bad Lineage
ENTRY.COMMENT: awkward break,saved ground,chased 7/16,3p far turn,empty lane
